_meanings:
(One of
the roots that govern two 
accusatives, see examples below)

{@--7@} To bring or reduce
any person to any state or condition;
{#tamapi taralatAmanayadanaMgaH#} <ls>K. 143</ls>;  
{#nItastvayA paMcatAM#} <ls>Ratn. 3. 3</ls>; <ls>R. 8. 19.</ls> 

(In this sense the root is used with
substantives much in the same way
as {#kf#} <ab>q. v.</ab>; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#duHKaM nI#} to reduce to
misery; {#vaSaM nI#} to reduce to subjection,
win over; {#astaM nI#} to cause to set;
{#vinASaM nI#} to destroy; {#paritozaM nI#} to
gratify, please; {#SUdratAM-dAsatvaM#} &c. {#nI#}
to reduce to the state of a Śūdra,
slave &c.; {#sAkzyaM nI#} to admit as a
witness; {#daMqaM nI#} to inflict 
punishment upon, to punish; {#punaruktatAM nI#}
to render superfluous; {#vikrayaM nI#} to
sell; {#BasmatAM-BasmasAt-nI#} to reduce to
ashes &c. &c.).
